intro: Jasminum perrottetianum, commonly known as the Persian jasmine, is a flowering plant native to regions of Asia, including parts of India and the Middle East. It is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a glossy, dark green appearance. The flowers are often used in perfumery and traditional medicine due to their aromatic properties.
